locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the metaphor of spiritual warfare, moving from contemporary examples (Bishop Ruiz) to biblical imagery (Isaiah, Revelation, Paul) to the reality of baptism as enlistment in God's army.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher connects the 'Man of War' in Exodus with the 'Lamb' in Revelation, emphasizing the paradox of non-violent victory through the Word.

illocutie.beschrijving: The sermon begins with heavy assertion (storytelling and exegesis) but shifts toward the end into strong commissive and declarative acts, specifically 'clothing' the hearer in Christ's armor.
voorbeelden: I wonder what you are confronting in your life.
Then take to yourself the armor of God.
He equips you to remain his faithful soldier.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from a passive observer of 'battle imagery' to an active, comforted participant who feels 'clothed' by God's own strength.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicit. The Spirit is identified as the weapon (Sword of the Spirit) and the one who empowers the speech act.

voorbeelden: The bishop is wearing a helmet.
There is a great deal of battle imagery in Scripture.
Paul envisions the whole human race caught up in a cosmic struggle.
Think about the early days.
Take to yourself the armor of God.
Put on the Lord Jesus Christ.
Can you imagine being shot for teaching the Bible?
I wonder what you are confronting.
He will go before you to break down the walls.
His faithfulness will overcome your doubt.
He equips you to remain his faithful soldier.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong. The promises are directly addressed to the 'you' of the congregation in the final third.

voorbeelden: You yourself are part of God’s new creation.
If you have been baptized, you are a beachhead for God.
His power is made perfect in your weakness.
declaratieven.autoriteit: High. The preacher speaks on behalf of the baptismal reality, changing the hearer's status from victim to 'beachhead'.

indicatoren: Lengthy historical anecdotes about Mexico and Afghanistan.
Detailed exegetical descriptions of Isaiah and Revelation imagery.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer may feel like a spectator of interesting facts for the first half of the sermon.

missende_elementen: More frequent direct address in the middle section.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Excellent. The 'toezegging' (promise) is the pivot point where the sermon moves from 'battle imagery' to 'your battle'.
voorbeelden: God clothes us with the patience of Christ himself.
He comes alongside us with the shield of faith.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Heavy use in the final application and baptismal address.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Directly used to apply the 'armor' to the hearer's specific struggles.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Used for biblical characters and historical figures.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'lecture' feel in the first 10 minutes.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General theological truths about the devil and armor.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Avoids the 'Jesus died -> so you must try harder' trap.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (The armor exists) -> Declarative (You are a beachhead) -> Commissive (He will go before you) -> Directive (Put on Christ).
voorbeelden: The armor... is God's own armor. (Assertive) -> You are part of God's new creation (Declarative) -> He will go before you (Commissive) -> Put on the Lord Jesus (Directive).
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Very strong theological grounding; the imperative is a response to the gift.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because 'His power is made perfect in your weakness', therefore 'Put on the Lord Jesus Christ'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon successfully transitions from 'talking about' spiritual warfare to 'performing' the act of clothing the congregation in Christ's righteousness.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: He embraces you with his love.
sterke_punten.effect: Creates an encounter with the living Christ.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long opening about the Mexican bishop.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event when the preacher stops describing the armor and starts handing it to the people.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The baptismal theology is used performatively to redefine the hearer's identity.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, especially through the 'Word' as the only weapon.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, the preacher acts as the one 'clothing' the flock.
tekstueel_bewijs: He equips you to remain his faithful soldier.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, the Spirit is the 'breath' and 'sword'.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicit; the preacher provides the armor, trusting the Spirit to make it 'fit'.
tekstueel_bewijs: He gave us his Spirit. He gave us his weapons.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon functions as an extension of baptism.
tekstueel_bewijs: He is as near to you as a breastplate.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'is/was' in the first half, but 'will/gives/is' (present) in the second half.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: There is a great deal of battle imagery in Scripture.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: God speaks to you today as a Man of War who fights for your freedom.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a literary observation to a present encounter.

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Keep the 'not your faith, but Christ's' distinction.
voorbeeldzinnen: I announce to you: Christ's faithfulness is your shield.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Interject 'you' earlier in the historical stories.
voorbeeldzinnen: Like that bishop, you too are under fire.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in moving from biblical 'locution' to sacramental 'illocution'. The final third of the sermon is a powerful performative act.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about the clippings; SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the Word to change the hearer's status.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: It doesn't just persuade the hearer that armor is good; it 'clothes' them in it via the speech act.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is not in the 'helmet' illustration, but in the 'Commissive' promises of Christ's presence.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: He is as near to you as a breastplate.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Collapses the distance between the ancient text and the hearer's body.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows a classic 'homiletical plot' that resolves in a sacramental 'event'.
